channel.title: Saving player data - Ideas?
channel.description:
Okay, this is always an issue when it comes to a server, for me at least. Yes we can use the standard text file but I don't see functionality in that. What I mean is. All it is is a text file, it sits in one location (being that you pick the location) and isn't all that secure, plus accessing it for use in other languages is beyond me (for instance: MySQL). I want to see where else we could go with player saving on a 317. I specify a 317 because I know that most/all 7xx use .p and idk what other revisions use (some still use .txt).
I was thinking maybe MySQL, but that sounds like a shitty idea being that most servers come with a character file with 20-40+ different ints and strings for various data in the server.
Also I though XML [i]could[/i] work because I've seen it used in servers in the past, and it doesn't seem that bad, but the naming and the tree structure might look nasty.
What do you guys think?

i’d use mysql, it’s fast and efficient if you know how to implement it right
iirc emps-scape uses mysql, and look how much players they have
you could do lots of things like hiscores, player profiles, and you could do more unique things and add integrated shops w/e

item.title: Saving player data - Ideas?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

The X stands for cross-platform, which includes Windows. WAMP does not include a lot of the same components as XAMPP, and is managed by an entirely different group afaik. But once again, you do not need all of those extra components. All you need is the sql daemon.

Read full topic

item.title: Saving player data - Ideas?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:66, topic:519834”]Look at the bottom of every SMF page you visit. You’ll see something like:

26 Separate queries, each one pulling large amounts of data to build the page. All within the blink of an eye. The problems all servers have is they use a MySQL server that is located in a different data center, usually half way across the world. The latency on that alone is what kills them.[/quote]
You could load everything on a wamp/xampp server and run it that way, there’d be little/no latency.

Read full topic

item.title: Saving player data - Ideas?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:64, topic:519834”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=638327.msg4306984#msg4306984 date=1370034384]

I was thinking maybe MySQL, but that sounds like a shitty idea being that most servers come with a character file with 20-40+ different ints and strings for various data in the server.

How do pretty much all forum softwares save data? With MySQL, and they have a lot more than 20-40 different fields.

To be honest, I’ve never dug into a lot of the forums and their saving.
Haven’t found a need to as everything is managed front end.
[/quote]

They use MySQL[/quote]
I know that. 99% of forums software makes you set up the table name and such.

Read full topic

item.title: Saving player data - Ideas?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Pick a relational database. As long as you layout your tables properly there will be no problems with it. You guys underestimate just how minute the differences are speed-wise.

Read full topic

item.title: Saving player data - Ideas?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:58, topic:519834”][quote author=xxxtilllyxxx link=topic=638327.msg4304340#msg4304340 date=1369517273]
It isn’t really a discussion. There’s a plethora of differently languages you could use. Binary, Java, text, sql. And many many more. When in reality, the best languages here to use are in focus. Binary, or SQL. Binary isn’t supported for integration with forums, whereas SQL is. If you want integration, SQL. If you want speed, Binary. Simple as this. Text is too slow, Java would be a waste, XML is slow.
[/quote]
Couldn’t you figure out a way to get the best of both worlds from Binary/Sql?
I mean, like have the data saved half and half (not really). Have binary save core server data, like bank, stats, quests, etc. Then have SQL save User/Pass/Rights. You save rights to SQL because you could integrate that into the forums someway somehow.[/quote]

can do that without the need to save half and half

Read full topic

item.title: Saving player data - Ideas?
item.dc:creator: @xxxtilllyxxx xxxtilllyxxx
item.description:
@xxxtilllyxxx wrote:

Could work, would be a huge waste, and incredibly resource heavy. Imagine you have 500+ players on at one time, and your server dc’s. Imaging 500 players logging in at the same time. Loading 2x the files needed. You either pick one or the other, because there is no best of both worlds in this scenario. SQL is fast, don’t get me wrong, but like I said, Binary is the fastest.

Read full topic
